instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Working on a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board that will power up and start to boot.  The display shows the normal Apple logo and progress bar then about half way through the progress bar the machine completely shuts off as if the battery was disconnected.  Board reacts normally to an SMC reset.  There is no indication of liquid damage.  Can someone point me in the right direction ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message:
Try to run EFI ASD.
You can also directly try clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Tried known good HDD or SATA cable??? This literally sounds like a dead HDD.....

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message:
I forgot to mention, start with external USB OSX through USB.
So you can discard HDD, or software issue.
I recently got one old iMac with same behavior, fixed by reinstalling OSX.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B tarts to boot then half way through just shuts off
threads.message: Turns out it was the HDD connector cable.  Replaced and now the system boots fine.
